Job Description:
Introduction
The Data Scientist will play a leading strategic role on Thermo Fisher Scientific’s Digital Innovation Services Data Science team. This position will develop and maintain cutting-edge machine learning systems. In this role you will push the boundaries of remote instrument technology through optimization of cloud ecosystems and complex data integration.
The ideal candidate has extensive data modeling, algorithm development, data engineering, database software development and database operation experience to design, build, and implement state-of-the art predictive models using a combination of statistical, mechanistic, signal processing, and machine learning approaches.
This position is hands-on, highly technical, with a high sense of urgency for daily tasks, a calculated, strategic approach for long term success and will be a core Digital Innovation Services member with extensive partnerships among business unit SMEs focused on integrating digital enablement across our instrument products to stream telemetry data and pioneering novel technologies.

Overview:
PURPOSE:
Perform functions including support, analysis, and business process development with the ability to work across multiple departments including farming, operations and sales.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Mine and analyze data from company databases and create apps and reports to drive optimization and improvement of agriculture operations
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
Use predictive modeling and linear programming optimize agriculture operations
Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality
Additional Info:

Benefits:

Job Title: Quantitative Researcher / Trader – High Frequency Futures
Job Description:
We are looking for highly skilled and experienced individuals to join a research effort focused on generating high frequency trading alphas in the futures markets. The ideal candidate has direct experience in the alpha research process and understands the workflow from idea generation to production implementation. This opportunity will provide the right candidate the chance to have a large impact on the direction and productivity of a nascent effort within a successful proprietary trading firm.
Responsibilities
Conduct data analysis on large datasets to generate profitable trading alphas.
Define key metrics for model validation.
Back testing and production performance monitoring.
Contribute to in-house data analysis packages and research framework development.

Company Description

Avery Dennison (NYSE: AVY) is a global materials science company specializing in the design and manufacture of a wide variety of labeling and functional materials. The company’s products, which are used in nearly every major industry, include pressure-sensitive materials for labels and graphic applications; tapes and other bonding solutions for industrial, medical, and retail applications; tags, labels and embellishments for apparel; and radio frequency identification (RFID) solutions serving retail apparel and other markets. Headquartered in Glendale, California, the company employs more than 30,000 employees in more than 50 countries. Reported sales in 2020 were $7.0 billion. Learn more at www.averydennison.com.

Job Description

Avery Dennison is seeking a dynamic individual to join the global Polymers, Adhesive and Coatings Center of Excellence (PACE) in Avery Dennison Label and Graphic Materials. The Research Principal will identify, develop and deploy new technology platforms to advance Avery Dennison’s innovation strategies and provide critical expertise in pressure sensitive adhesive chemistry and applications. The successful candidate will help translate business strategy to technical needs, engage internally and externally to identify and assess new ideas, and develop fundamental understanding necessary to bring new chemistry from idea to commercial success.

Purpose and Scope
The Business Analytics Manager leads the demand planning process for the commercial team including collecting the volume and pricing data from all key data sources, as well as compiling the business understanding and assumptions that will be included in the forecast for the purpose of forecast for business planning decisions. This role is also responsible for working cross functionally to determine forecast assumptions and inputs with the manufacturing operations planning, accounting, contracts and pricing, sales leadership, market access, and marketing. Those assumptions will be incorporated into the forecast, vetted with the cross functional team, and adjusted as needed to gain agreement for senior leadership.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Builds the commercial demand and revenue forecast to TPI commercial business.

We Are Hiring:
Ascension Seton is hiring a RN to conduct research studies, assist bedside nurses with research, and support CNOs at Magent sites with research. Previous research experience coupled with leadership experience, and a PHD are strongly preferred.

Schedule Monday-Friday 8-4:30PM

Magnet Recognition®
Magnet Recognition®, given by the American Nurses Credentialing Center, is the only national designation that recognizes nurses as integral team members in influencing positive patient outcomes. The nursing practice environment at Ascension Seton supports shared governance, interdisciplinary collaboration, leadership, quality, safety, professional development and work-life balance. The focus of Magnet is . Research has demonstrated that nurse satisfaction and patient outcomes are higher in Magnet hospitals than in other hospitals.

TriLink BioTechnologies is actively responding to the COVID-19 pandemic through vaccine and diagnostic programs.
TriLink BioTechnologies, a Maravai LifeSciences company, is seeking a Application Scientist to join our growing team. This role is responsible for developing relationships with external partners and customers in support of identifying innovative and long-term opportunities to create value for the client and TriLink Biotechnologies. Drive core and strategic revenue growth via the development of content and insight/data contributions to multi-channel marketing campaigns to support the company's long-term growth objectives: publicly present data and comprehensive product education. Successful performance increases overall TriLink revenue, profitability, and market share by driving product awareness, adoption, and utilization by customers.
A technical resource that can answer advanced customer inquiries and support TriLink scientific credibility, further demonstrating the company's expertise in our core markets. The application scientist role is expected to perform as technical support, conference presenter, webinar presenter, "lunch and learn" field representation.

CareJourney’s mission is to empower individuals and organizations they trust with open, clinically-relevant analytics and insights in the pursuit of the optimal healthcare journey. We are a fast-growing start-up in Arlington, VA that builds software products to serve industry-leading customers that include Pfizer, Humana, and Microsoft. Our founders and leadership developed the policy and technology in the public and private sector that shape the work we do today. We are looking for driven professionals that are excited to join a growing business where they will have a strong voice in the direction and success of the company. Our culture embraces teamwork and cross-functional collaboration for a fun and exciting environment.

Our team is looking for a talented, motivated, and high-performing Senior Data Engineer to join our team.
Key Responsibilities
Serve as a technical lead on initiatives, projects and implementations.
Support and develop data flows by developing processes that verify, standardize, and scale data input, transformation and storage.

Composites Scientist
You will have the opportunity to develop state-of-the-art nanomaterials using advanced techniques and instruments for materials characterization in a fast-paced supportive environment with coworkers of diverse backgrounds.
We are a well-funded fast-growing stealth-mode company located in San Jose, CA. Our company has developed a breakthrough technology to custom design and manufacture 3D graphene and other carbon allotropes. Graphene has the promise to transform many industries because of it's astounding properties. It's over 200 times stronger than steel, flexible, transparent, a great thermal conductor and the most conductive material that we know exists. The list of possible applications is expansive including game-changing battery electrodes, transparent touch displays, innovative composite materials, IoT sensors and solar panels just to name a few.

Our leadership team is seasoned in leading startups from an early stage to multibillion-dollar companies. Our development teams have extensive experience in successfully launching products from concept to production. As validation that we are on the forefront of this coming transformation, we have acquired multiple revenue producing commercial and government contracts and have opened a new facility in San Jose to scale our production and accelerate our growth in key product development areas.

This role supports the new Rapid Diagnostics Solutions (RDS) business unit in San Diego, California, part of the group of diagnostics businesses at Thermo Fisher Scientific. We are focused on increasing access to affordable innovations in diagnostic testing and enabling data-driven decisions. What we do matters because our work has a direct impact on people’s lives, and we take that responsibility seriously.

How will you make an impact?

The Scientist II will work to develop rapid, point-of-care molecular diagnostic assay products. This position is responsible for developing and validating assay chemistry, integrating chemistry with proprietary instrumentation, coordinating product development between R&D and Engineering, and assist in design transfer to manufacturing in an ISO 13485 environment. Daily activities include: the initial assay development to meet product requirements, feasibility experimentation, composition of SOP documents and product transfer into manufacturing, verification and validation testing, and on-going support of transferred products.





At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 75,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

Introduction
JoinASML Wilton today to receive your sign on bonus and relocation.
Offer valid for Wilton, CT new hire offers made between now and December15, 2021.
ASML US brings together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, the Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.

We are currently searching for a Data Engineer to develop strategies for warehouse implementation and data archiving. Design and build data models to optimize reporting. Design, build and support ETL solutions to centralize and automate data collection. Assist in the development, maintenance, and support of an enterprise data warehouse and its corresponding data marts and data pipelines. Troubleshoot and tune system performance.
Essential Functions
Design and build solutions to build a strong data architecture (ETL/Data architecture/Data reporting/Data management/Data Warehouse)
Design and develop data pipelines as needed for internal or external data sources (Data extraction/Uploading/Formatting/Storing)
Design and develop data models for efficient reporting (Data architecture)

Scientist
Liver Disease, NASH
About TrueBinding, Inc.
TrueBinding, Inc. is a preclinical and clinical stage biotech company developing first-in-class therapeutic antibody drugs for applications to treat cancer, metabolic diseases, immuno-fibrosis, autoimmune and neurodegeneration diseases, based on our proprietary TrueBinding platform. In our state-of-the-art laboratories, we are seeking innovative and disruptive therapies for highly unmet medical needs.
Job Summary:
We are seeking an experienced Scientist for our Biology Division with a strong background in liver diseases research, ideally having worked with NASH.
